intro: Mahernia exappendiculata, commonly known as the slender-stemmed mahernia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring narrow, woody stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense, spherical clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Mahernia exappendiculata is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with mechanisms to store water and reduce transpiration.
